name: dilatancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the property of some substances to become more solid under pressure: Dilatancy is the change of overall volume produced by strain in an assembly of particles. The very thin veins that developed in clay-rich areas suggest that they episodically underwent dilatancy.
More examplesFewer examplesThis relates to a property of granular materials under pressure called the "principle of dilatancy".Earthquakes may be caused by dilatancy - massive cracking of rock within the Earth in response to an increase in tectonic strain.
